messages.title: Someone needs to stand up for our NHS and schools...
messages.content:
"NHS cuts blamed for 30,000 deaths in new study." - The Independent, 17 Feb 2017
"Schools face the worst funding cuts in 20 years." - The Mirror, 27 Mar 2017
...and Labour is too busy fighting each other to stand up for them.
"Labour is fatally divided inside Parliament and outside it." - New Statesman, 30 Mar 2017
"We cannot fight and win with Jeremy as leader." - Labour MP Jack Dromey

messages.title: ONLY A LIB DEM VOTE WILL GET OUR NHS AND SCHOOLS THE SUPPORT THEY NEED
messages.content:
"Lib Dems pledge to spend twice as much on education as Labour." - The Independent, 5 Apr 2017
"The Liberal Democrats have pledged to raise Income Tax by a penny for every earner to fund a £6bn-a-year cash injection for the NHS and social care." - The Guardian, 15 May 2017

messages.title: WHO WILL REALLY FIGHT FOR OUR NHS?
messages.content:
The Lib Dems have been winning elections across the country. More people than ever have joined the Lib Dems - we can win on 8th June.
Labour is letting us down. Their support is crumbling. They are too busy fighting each other to stand up for our NHS.
"Labour is fatally divided inside parliament and outside it." - New Statesman, 30 Mar 2017
Vote for the party that will deliver for our NHS and schools - VOTE LIBERAL DEMOCRAT

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dems pledge to spend twice as much on education as Labour.
The Liberal Democrats have pledged to raise Income Tax by a penny for every earner to fund a £6bn-a-year cash injection for the NHS and social care.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In many parts of the country the Conservatives can't win this time - it's Lib Dem or Labour.
